text.more:
This graph represents the network analysis of the fist seven chapters of the first part ("Infanzia: Storia di Don Achille") of the book, "My Brilliant Friend"; it described the characters' lives and mainly focus on their families as represented also by the graph.
The sole character that doesn't belong inherently to the familial sphere, is the teacher Oliviero, who plays a huge part in the seventh character and introduces the theme of 'school', being the first one to acknowledge Lila's exceptional abilities.
This first part starts with the recounting by the narrator, Lenù, of when she and Lila went to retrieve their dolls from Don Achille, and ends with the meeting between teacher Oliviero and Lila's mother, Mrs. Cerullo, to inform her of the talent of the daughter.
text.intro: Browse through the graph, analyzing the various relationships between the characters of the first part (chapter 1-7) of the book "My Brilliant Friend", to understand what has brought Lila and Lenù together and to understand their own social contexts.
text.title: Chapters 1-7
